english: The old man stopped for a moment to rest.
spanish: El anciano se detuvo un momento para descansar.

english: Does anybody know how the fire started?
spanish: ¿Alguien sabe cómo se desató el fuego?

english: I can't give up smoking.
spanish: No puedo dejar de fumar.

english: I'd like to be alone now.
spanish: Me gustaría estar solo ahora.

english: It is difficult to say which vehicle is more beautiful.
spanish: Es difícil decir cuál vehículo es más bello.

english: Are you trying to tell me something?
spanish: ¿Estás intentando decirme algo?

english: Have you ever lost your luggage at the airport?
spanish: ¿Alguna vez has perdido tu equipaje en el aeropuerto?

english: Where do you want to go?
spanish: ¿Adónde querés ir?

english: You still seem to be upset.
spanish: Aún pareces estar molesto.

english: Does that make it any clearer?
spanish: ¿Ayuda eso a aclararlo?

english: Thank you for your time.
spanish: Gracias por su tiempo.

english: She loves her son dearly.
spanish: Ella quiere con locura a su hijo.

english: Some did not know how to fight.
spanish: Algunos no sabían combatir.

english: I need to charge my mobile.
spanish: Tengo que cargar el móvil.

english: Tom is in his room.
spanish: Tom está en su habitación.

english: He is deaf, but knows how to read lips.
spanish: Él está sordo, pero sabe leer los labios.

english: There are four seasons in a year.
spanish: Hay cuatro estaciones al año.

english: I'd like to get started.
spanish: Me gustaría empezar cuanto antes.

english: I am in a new house.
spanish: Estoy en una casa nueva.

english: Not all blondes are dumb.
spanish: No todas las rubias son estúpidas.

english: There is something very charming about you.
spanish: Hay algo muy encantador en ti.

english: I'll give you either of these stamps.
spanish: Te daré cualquiera de estos sellos.

english: They contrived to arrive in time after all.
spanish: Ellos se las arreglaron para llegar a tiempo después de todo.

english: Where are you off to?
spanish: ¿Adónde vas saliendo?

english: I looked to see if he was teasing me.
spanish: Lo miré para ver si me estaba tomando el pelo.

english: I hope that what you are eating is healthy.
spanish: Espero que lo que estés comiendo sea saludable.

english: He despises people of a lower social class.
spanish: Desprecia a la gente de clase social más baja.

english: I forgot to lock the storeroom.
spanish: Se me olvidó cerrar el almacén.

english: I have some books that you might like to read.
spanish: Tengo algunos libros que te podrían gustar.

english: It was already late, so I went back home.
spanish: Ya era tarde, así que volví a casa.

english: I'm sick and tired of hamburgers.
spanish: Estoy harta de hamburguesas.

english: I congratulate you on your success.
spanish: Le felicito por su triunfo.

english: There were no hats in that store that fit me.
spanish: No había ningún sobrero en esa tienda que me quedara.

english: How many more are there?
spanish: ¿Cuántos más hay?

english: Did he learn Japanese as well?
spanish: ¿Él también aprendió japonés?

english: I was born the year my grandfather died.
spanish: Nací el año en que murió mi abuelo.

english: My attitude towards him changed.
spanish: Mi actitud hacia él cambió.

english: Where is the end of this line?
spanish: ¿Dónde está el final de esta fila?

english: Tom used to write songs.
spanish: Tom solía escribir canciones.

english: Can you sing this song?
spanish: ¿Puedes cantar esta canción?

english: He dropped a letter into the mailbox.
spanish: Él tiró una carta en el buzón.

english: Why do I have to talk to Tom?
spanish: ¿Por qué tengo que hablar con Tom?

english: We'll be able to go on when it clears up.
spanish: Cuando escampe podremos seguir.

english: I'm not as happy now.
spanish: Ahora no soy tan feliz.

english: At last, she solved the problem.
spanish: Al final, ella resolvió el problema.

english: I don't care what you say.
spanish: No me importa lo que decís.

english: I've got a frog in my throat.
spanish: Tengo la garganta hecha polvo.

english: I'm on campus at the moment.
spanish: Por el momento estoy en el campus.

english: You don't speak English, do you?
spanish: Tú no hablas inglés, ¿verdad?

english: Tom doesn't want to get his hands dirty.
spanish: Tom no quiere ensuciarse las manos.

english: Don't quote me on this, but I agree with you.
spanish: No digas que yo te lo he dicho, pero estoy de acuerdo contigo.

english: We will wait for you there.
spanish: Te esperamos allá.

english: I feel like a million bucks.
spanish: Me siento como un millón de dólares.

english: Add up this column of figures.
spanish: Sume usted esta columna de cifras.

english: How exactly did Tom die?
spanish: ¿Cómo murió Tom exactamente?

english: You'll have three relationships before you meet your true soulmate.
spanish: Tendrás tres relaciones antes de que encuentres a tu verdadera alma gemela.

english: Tom should be home by 2:30.
spanish: Tom debería estar en casa a las 2:30.

english: My sister was in New York a year ago.
spanish: Mi hermana estaba en Nueva York hace un año atrás.

english: My boss invited me to dinner.
spanish: Mi jefe me invitó a cenar.

english: Has the mail been sorted?
spanish: ¿Han distribuido el correo?

english: I was there last night.
spanish: Yo estuve ahí anoche.

english: Where have you been all this time?
spanish: ¿Dónde has estado todo este tiempo?

english: All the delegates knew they must discuss it.
spanish: Todos los delegados sabían que debían debatirlo.

english: Do you like to be alone?
spanish: ¿Les gusta estar solos?

english: We were deeply impressed by the lecturer's eloquent speech.
spanish: Estábamos profundamente impresionados por el elocuente discurso del expositor.

english: You can't enter the building without a permit.
spanish: No puedes entrar al edificio sin autorización.

english: Do you know why this date is important?
spanish: ¿Sabes por qué es importante esta fecha?

english: The bigger they come, the harder they fall.
spanish: Cuanto más alto suban, más dura será la caída.

english: How should you advertise on the Internet?
spanish: ¿Cómo deberías anunciarte en internet?

english: My uncle lived abroad for many years.
spanish: Mi tío ha vivido muchos años en el extranjero.

english: There's a garden in front of our house.
spanish: Hay un jardín en frente de nuestra casa.

english: I'm afraid Tom will get lost.
spanish: Estoy asustado de que Tom se pierda.

english: I am ashamed of my son's conduct.
spanish: Estoy avergonzado de la conducta de mi hijo.

english: Excuse me, where's the American Embassy?
spanish: Perdona, ¿sabes dónde está la embajada estadounidense?

english: I want a low table.
spanish: Quiero una mesa baja.

english: Tom doesn't like to speak French.
spanish: A Tom no le gusta hablar en francés.

english: How big is your house?
spanish: ¿Qué tan grande es tu casa?

english: They're very fond of him.
spanish: Le tienen mucho cariño.

english: You do a great job.
spanish: Haces un trabajo muy importante.

english: Excuse me for interrupting you.
spanish: Perdone que le interrumpa.

english: I will teach you to play chess.
spanish: Te voy a enseñar a jugar al ajedrez.

english: Tom had a chance to meet Mary in Boston.
spanish: Tom tuvo la oportunidad de encontrarse con Mary en Boston.

english: The guards didn't see Tom.
spanish: Los guardias no vieron a Tom.

english: With these headphones, I can't hear anything.
spanish: No puedo escuchar nada cuando estoy usando estos auriculares.

english: Would you like to see some photos of my trip?
spanish: ¿Te gustaría ver algunas fotos de mi viaje?

english: Do you want to sell them?
spanish: ¿Quieres venderlos?

english: I left one of my books at school.
spanish: Dejé uno de mis libros en la escuela.

english: I don't want to see you again.
spanish: No quiero volver a verte.

english: The store is open from nine to six.
spanish: La tienda está abierta de nueve a seis.

english: My mother gets up early in the morning.
spanish: Mi mamá se levanta temprano por la mañana.

english: Many people attended the meeting.
spanish: Mucha gente concurrió a la sesión.

english: Tom left before Mary arrived.
spanish: Tom se fue antes de que Mary llegara.

english: Tom is the one that didn't want you to know.
spanish: Tom es el que no quería que lo supieras.

english: It's bad luck to say that.
spanish: Decir eso da mala suerte.

english: The delegates elected him on the first vote.
spanish: Los delegados lo eligieron en la primera votación.

english: Tom and Mary just don't hit it off.
spanish: Tom y Mary simplemente no se llevan bien.

english: I report to work at 9 o'clock every morning.
spanish: Entro a trabajar a las nueve en punto cada mañana.

english: I'm looking for a present for my mother.
spanish: Estoy buscando un regalo para mi madre.

english: My wife works part time.
spanish: Mi mujer trabaja a tiempo parcial.

english: It is no use arguing with him about it.
spanish: Es inútil discutir con él sobre eso.

english: I was going to ask for a volunteer.
spanish: Iba a pedir un voluntario.

english: Don't leave your belongings unattended at the beach.
spanish: No dejes tus pertenencias desatendidas en el playa.

english: It'll be hard to find the time to do that.
spanish: Será complicado sacar tiempo para hacerlo.

english: I'm not going to argue with you.
spanish: No voy a discutirlo contigo.

english: Tom's girlfriend saw him with another girl.
spanish: La novia de Tom le vio con otra chica.

english: Sometimes the first symptom of cardiovascular disease is death.
spanish: A veces, el primer síntoma de una enfermedad cardiovascular es la muerte.

english: It's a miracle that Tom is still alive.
spanish: Es un milagro que Tom siga vivo.

english: My friend has a large family.
spanish: Mi amigo tiene una gran familia.

english: That was a huge breakthrough.
spanish: Eso fue un enorme avance.

english: He comes into contact with all kinds of people.
spanish: Él trata con todo tipo de personas.

english: Tom never works on Sunday.
spanish: Tom no trabaja nunca los domigos.

english: Tom complained that his back hurt.
spanish: Tom se quejaba de dolor de espalda.

english: What a pity she can't come!
spanish: ¡Qué lástima que no pueda venir!

english: Tom tried to talk Mary into driving all night.
spanish: Tom trató de convencer a Mary de conducir la noche entera.

english: I'm not disturbing you, am I?
spanish: No te molesto, ¿verdad?

english: The food was so good that I ate too much.
spanish: La comida era tan buena que comí demasiada.

english: I have to button my jacket.
spanish: Tengo que abotonarme la chaqueta.

english: He does not like what the journalists have said.
spanish: A él no le gusta lo que han dicho los periodistas.

english: I have to go to the bank.
spanish: Tengo que ir al banco.

english: Is she going to go to America this year?
spanish: ¿Va a ir ella a Estados Unidos este año?

english: Why do you want to work for our company?
spanish: ¿Por qué querés trabajar para nuestra compañía?

english: Tom showed me how to do it.
spanish: Tom me enseñó cómo hacerlo.

english: Do you know how to get to Tom's house?
spanish: ¿Sabes cómo ir a la casa de Tom?

english: No, thank you. I am just looking.
spanish: No, gracias. Solo estoy mirando.

english: Tom explained the project to Mary.
spanish: Tom le explicó el proyecto a Mary.

english: Both countries are now at peace.
spanish: Ambos países están en paz ahora.

english: I couldn't help but laugh to myself.
spanish: No pude evitar reírme.

english: You may choose whichever book you like.
spanish: Podéis elegir el libro que queráis.

english: I'm dead if I stay here.
spanish: Estoy muerto si me quedo aquí.

english: Where exactly did you find that?
spanish: ¿Dónde exactamente encontraste eso?

english: I assure you it's quite unnecessary.
spanish: Te aseguro que es bastante innecesario.

english: Nothing can force me to give it up.
spanish: Nada va a hacerme abandonar.

english: Tom is the star of the show.
spanish: Tom es la estrella del programa.

english: The boys bring their books every day.
spanish: Los chicos traen sus libros todos los días.

english: I want to see Tom now.
spanish: Quiero ver a Tom ya.

english: Tom knows Mary isn't very happy here.
spanish: Tom sabe que Mary no es muy feliz aquí.

english: A known mistake is better than an unknown truth.
spanish: Un error conocido es mejor que una verdad desconocida.

english: My aunt showed me how to make good coffee.
spanish: Mi tía me enseñó a hacer buen café.

english: I'd rather not meet him.
spanish: Preferiría no encontrarme con él.

english: Tom killed his own father.
spanish: Tomás mató a su propio padre.

english: I think about him all the time.
spanish: Paso todo el tiempo pensando en él.

english: It's necessary for you to go.
spanish: Es necesario que te vayas.

english: I think Tom will be able to help.
spanish: Creo que Tom podrá ayudar.

english: There is a full moon tonight.
spanish: Hay luna llena esta noche.

english: I know what you're going to say.
spanish: Ya sé qué vais a decir.

english: Sirius is the brightest star in the night sky.
spanish: Sirius es la estrella más brillante del cielo nocturno.

english: I've got to catch some Z's.
spanish: Tengo que dormir un poco.

english: This book has many beautiful pictures.
spanish: Este libro tiene muchas imágenes bellas.

english: What does Tom want to eat?
spanish: ¿Qué quiere comer Tomás?

english: You ought not to miss it.
spanish: No deben perdérselo.

english: I met him on my way home from school.
spanish: Me encontré con él en el camino del colegio a la casa.

english: This is a dangerous road.
spanish: Es una calle peligrosa.

english: Tom can speak French better than I can.
spanish: Tom puede hablar francés mejor que yo.

english: Tom wanted to change the subject.
spanish: Tom quería cambiar el tema.

english: I knew you were going to ask that.
spanish: Sabía que ibas a preguntar eso.

english: Could you tell what he said?
spanish: ¿Podría decir lo que él dijo?

english: Tom ought to have told Mary the truth.
spanish: Tom debería haberle dicho la verdad a Mary.

english: I felt a deep pain.
spanish: Sentí un dolor intenso.

english: Can we have a moment alone?
spanish: ¿Podemos estar un momento a solas?

english: Too much is at stake.
spanish: Demasiado está en riesgo.

english: Examinations interfere with the real purpose of education.
spanish: Las pruebas obstaculizan el verdadero propósito de la educación.

english: Tom thinks the answer is yes.
spanish: Tom piensa que la respuesta es sí.

english: He tried to give up smoking several times, but failed.
spanish: Él trató de dejar de fumar varias veces pero no pudo.

english: Can I take a picture of you?
spanish: ¿Te puedo tomar una foto?

english: There are too many people in the park.
spanish: Hay demasiada gente en el parque.

english: You have to acquire real skills, not just superficial knowledge.
spanish: Tienes que adquirir verdaderas destrezas, no simplemente conocimientos superficiales.

english: He knows how to make women cry.
spanish: Él sabe cómo hacer llorar a las mujeres.

english: I told you not to call me at work.
spanish: Te dije que no me llames al trabajo.

english: I stay home alone while my parents are at work.
spanish: Me quedo solo en casa mientras mis padres trabajan.

english: He disappeared in the crowd.
spanish: Él desapareció entre la multitud.

english: Do you like my clothes?
spanish: ¿Te gusta mi ropa?

english: He came home three hours later.
spanish: Él volvió a casa tres horas después.

english: What can you do for me?
spanish: ¿Qué puedes hacer por mi?

english: He accepted gifts from them.
spanish: Él aceptó regalos de parte de ellos.

english: Tom and Mary did what they were told.
spanish: Tom y Mary hacían lo que les decían.

english: He doesn't really speak French.
spanish: En realidad no habla francés.

english: My hobby is playing golf.
spanish: Mi pasatiempo es jugar golf.

english: I knew Tom wasn't dead.
spanish: Sabía que Tom no estaba muerto.

english: I got out of the car at 40th Street.
spanish: Me bajé del auto en la calle 40.

english: It was a remarkable experience.
spanish: Fue una experiencia extraordinaria.

english: He insulted me without reason.
spanish: Él me insultó sin motivo.

english: How heavy is your suitcase?
spanish: ¿Cuánto pesa vuestra maleta?

english: I'm not interested in modern art.
spanish: No me interesa el arte moderno.

english: He does not have any friends.
spanish: Él no tiene amigos.

english: Don't you want to know?
spanish: ¿No quieres saberlo?

english: Are you seriously thinking about divorce?
spanish: ¿Acaso estás pensando seriamente en el divorcio?

english: What's your favorite type of seafood?
spanish: ¿Qué tipo de marisco es tu preferido?

english: The two friends got on well together.
spanish: Los dos amigos hacían buenas migas.

english: Tom was killed with an icepick.
spanish: Mataron a Tom con un picahielos.

english: Tom was soaked to the skin.
spanish: Tom estaba empapado hasta la piel.

english: "Fast" is the opposite of "slow."
spanish: "Rápido" es el antónimo de "lento".

english: I remember everything you tell me.
spanish: Recuerdo todo lo que me dices.

english: I want to talk to you before you leave.
spanish: Quiero hablar con usted antes de que salga.

english: The news confirmed my suspicions.
spanish: Las noticias han confirmado mis sospechas.

english: Eat your dinner before it gets cold.
spanish: Comé la cena antes de que se enfríe.

english: There must've been a tacit understanding between them.
spanish: Tiene que haber existido un acuerdo tácito entre ellos.

english: Tom eats like a pig.
spanish: Tom come como un cerdo.

english: I'd like you to come work for me.
spanish: Quiero que vengas a trabajar conmigo.

english: I want to live in a big city.
spanish: Quiero vivir en una gran ciudad.

english: Don't forget to call me up tomorrow.
spanish: No olvides llamarme mañana.

english: It won't hurt to try doing that.
spanish: No perjudicará intentar hacerlo.

english: Maria Callas was a famous opera singer.
spanish: María Callas fue una famosa cantante de ópera.

english: Tom feeds his dog twice a day.
spanish: Tom alimenta a su perro dos veces al día.

english: You must clean your room.
spanish: Debes limpiar tu habitación.

english: I nearly forgot to give it to Tom.
spanish: Casi se me olvidó dárselo a Tom.

english: It is quite a big number.
spanish: Es un número bastante grande.

english: Five gallons of regular, please.
spanish: Cinco galones de normal, por favor.

english: I sat between Tom and John.
spanish: Me senté entre Tom y John.

english: He saved a child from drowning in a pond.
spanish: Él salvó a un niño de ahogarse en un estanque.

english: Tom needs some new clothes.
spanish: Tom necesita algo de ropa nueva.

english: Tom made a sandwich for Mary.
spanish: Tom le hizo un bocadillo a Mary.

english: You should pay for it.
spanish: Deberías pagarlo.

english: I'm almost thirty years old.
spanish: Casi tengo treinta años.

english: You were taken in by her.
spanish: Ella te ha tomado el pelo.

english: She is dressed like a bride.
spanish: Ella está vestida de novia.

english: Thank you for remembering my birthday.
spanish: Gracias por recordar mi cumpleaños.

english: I assumed you were Canadian.
spanish: Supuse que eras canadiense.

english: He is also very famous in Japan.
spanish: También es muy popular en Japón.

english: I know Tom is allergic to peanuts.
spanish: Sé que Tom es alérgico a los cacahuates.

english: I'm sorry, my father is out.
spanish: Perdón pero mi padre no está en casa.

english: She didn't give me her name.
spanish: Ella no me ha dicho su nombre.

english: She's used to getting up early.
spanish: Ella está acostumbrada a levantarse temprano.

english: He passed away several days before his hundredth birthday.
spanish: Él murió un par de días antes de su cumpleaños número cien.

english: The treatment is going successfully.
spanish: El tratamiento está siendo exitoso.

english: He has been playing tennis since this morning.
spanish: Ha estado jugando al tenis desde esta mañana.

english: I'm not a violent person.
spanish: No soy una persona violenta.

english: The sentence doesn't have any grammatical errors.
spanish: La oración no tiene errores gramaticales.

english: What is your blood type?
spanish: ¿Cuál es tu tipo de sangre?

english: When she arrives, talk to her.
spanish: Cuando ella llegue, háblale.

english: He makes a bad impression.
spanish: Da una mala impresión.

english: I didn't have enough time to finish my presentation.
spanish: No tuve suficiente tiempo para terminar mi presentación

english: Where is the entrance to the museum?
spanish: ¿Dónde está la entrada del museo?

english: I heard the boys singing.
spanish: Oí a los niños cantar.

english: Tom goes to the library at least once a month.
spanish: Tom va a la biblioteca al menos una vez por mes.

english: If he doesn't accept the job, somebody else will.
spanish: Si él no acepta el trabajo, alguien más lo hará.

english: The teacher asked me which book I liked.
spanish: El profesor me preguntó cuál de los libros me había gustado.

english: I've been here since Monday.
spanish: Llevo aquí desde el lunes.

english: They are happy with the result.
spanish: Ellos están contentos con el resultado.

english: Tom didn't sharpen the pencils.
spanish: Tomás no afiló los lápices.

english: His house was sold for ten thousand dollars.
spanish: Su casa fue vendida por diez mil dólares.

english: I'm just going to answer the call of nature.
spanish: Me voy a responder a la llamada de la naturaleza.

english: He carved a Buddhist image out of wood.
spanish: Él talló una imagen budista en madera.

english: This is your special day.
spanish: Este es tu día especial.

english: The rich are different from you and me.
spanish: Los ricos son diferentes a ti y a mí.

english: There are many islands in Greece.
spanish: Hay muchas islas en Grecia.

english: Tom can't be hungry. He's just eaten dinner.
spanish: Tom no puede tener hambre, acaba de cenar.

english: There seems to be no need to hurry.
spanish: No parece que haya prisa.

english: It's not that big a deal.
spanish: No es para tanto.

english: Tom respects Mary a lot.
spanish: Tom respeta mucho a Mary.

english: It won't be the same without you.
spanish: No será lo mismo sin ti.

english: I have to let you go.
spanish: Tengo que dejarte ir.

english: He asked her where she lived.
spanish: Él le preguntó dónde vivía.

english: Why did you buy a flower?
spanish: ¿Por qué compraste una flor?

english: Barack Obama is a Christian.
spanish: Barack Obama es cristiano.

english: Boys are more aggressive than girls.
spanish: Los chicos son más agresivos que las chicas.

english: There are a great number of schools in this city.
spanish: En esta ciudad hay muchas escuelas.

english: I have to get some new clothes.
spanish: Tengo que comprar algunas pilchas nuevas.

english: There won't be a next time.
spanish: No habrá una próxima vez.

english: What did you want to talk about?
spanish: ¿De qué querías hablar?

english: "What's going to happen?" "I don't know."
spanish: «¿Y ahora qué?» «No lo sé.»

english: I need to talk to both of you.
spanish: Necesito hablar con ustedes dos.

english: I haven't seen one of these in years.
spanish: No he visto uno de estos en años.

english: Cats hate to get wet.
spanish: Los gatos odian mojarse.

english: Did you see the sunrise earlier? It was really beautiful.
spanish: ¿Miraste la salida del sol más temprano? Fue realmente hermoso.

english: Language is the most important invention of the man.
spanish: El lenguaje es la más importante invención del ser humano.

english: He crushed the stone completely.
spanish: Machacó la piedra completamente.

english: He is the last man I want to see.
spanish: Él es el último hombre que quiero ver.

english: I get goose bumps when I see a horror movie.
spanish: Cuando veo una película de terror se me pone la carne de gallina.

english: Tom doesn't think Mary will do the job very well.
spanish: Tom no cree que María vaya a hacer muy bien el trabajo.

english: Why does everything happen to me?
spanish: ¿Por qué todo me pasa a mí?

english: Happiness isn't merely having many possessions.
spanish: La felicidad no consiste en tener solamente bienes materiales.

english: I am happy to hear your voice.
spanish: Estoy feliz de oír tu voz.

english: I'm going to Tom's tonight.
spanish: Voy a ir a lo de Tomás esta noche.

english: That's a sight for sore eyes.
spanish: Eso es una vista magnífica.

english: Does anyone oppose the new plan?
spanish: ¿Alguien se opone a la nueva propuesta?

english: A burglar broke into his house.
spanish: Un ladrón entró a su casa.

english: I can't walk any further.
spanish: No puedo caminar más.

english: We already know each other.
spanish: Ya nos conocemos el uno al otro.

english: Tom died two years ago in a plane crash.
spanish: Tom murió hace dos años en un accidente de avión.

english: Your effort will surely bear fruit.
spanish: Seguro que tus esfuerzos darán su fruto.

english: Let me tell you something about Boston.
spanish: Déjame decirte algo acerca de Boston.

english: He came from the south.
spanish: Él vino del sur.

english: Fortunately, the weather was good.
spanish: Por suerte hizo buen tiempo.

english: I promise I won't look.
spanish: Prometo que no voy a mirar.

english: You are tall, but he is still taller.
spanish: Eres alto, pero él es todavía más alto.

english: I want to speak German.
spanish: Quiero hablar alemán.

english: I can't leave work until five o'clock.
spanish: No puedo salir del trabajo hasta las cinco.

english: Pretty much everyone does that.
spanish: Casi todo el mundo hace eso.

english: What kind of work will you do?
spanish: ¿Qué clase de trabajo harás?

english: I can't see anything with my right eye.
spanish: No veo nada con el ojo derecho.

english: I know it's not a joke.
spanish: Sé que no es una broma.

english: It only takes a few minutes.
spanish: Tomará solo unos minutos.

english: I'm so glad you showed up.
spanish: Me alegro mucho de que te hayas pasado.

english: He was a forceful leader.
spanish: Él fue un líder forzado.

english: Why don't you trust me?
spanish: ¿Por qué no confiáis en mí?

english: My husband usually leaves for work at 8 o'clock.
spanish: Mi marido suele irse a trabajar a las 8.

english: I hope that you'll help me.
spanish: Espero que me ayudes.

english: Did Tom listen to you?
spanish: ¿Tom te escuchó?

english: It is difficult for me to solve that problem.
spanish: Es difícil para mí resolver ese problema.

english: I think this belongs to you.
spanish: Creo que esto les pertenece.

english: We mustn't let this news get out.
spanish: No debemos permitir que esta noticia se divulgue.

english: I'm going to be too busy to do that.
spanish: Voy a estar demasiado liado para hacer eso.

english: What you said surprised me.
spanish: Lo que dijiste me sorprendió.

english: Tom is planting a palm tree in his backyard.
spanish: Tom está plantando una palmera en su patio.

english: She was born in the 1950s.
spanish: Ella nació en la década del 50.

english: Don't do it! It's stupid and dangerous.
spanish: ¡No lo hagas!, es estúpido y peligroso.

english: Do you know Tom personally?
spanish: ¿Lo conocés a Tomás personalmente?

english: I'm leaving on a trip at the beginning of winter.
spanish: A la entrada del invierno saldré de viaje.

english: I never imagined he'd do that to me.
spanish: Nunca me imaginé que él me haría eso.

english: I've never done this in my life.
spanish: Nunca he hecho esto en mi vida.

english: I worked a lot today.
spanish: Hoy he trabajado mucho.

english: Why don't we ask his advice?
spanish: ¿Por qué no le pedimos consejo?

english: I just need some information.
spanish: Solo necesito algo de información.

english: Tom asked me to speak more slowly.
spanish: Tom me pidió que hablara más lento.

english: Don't hesitate to tell me if you need anything.
spanish: No vaciles en decirme si necesitas cualquier cosa.

english: It's difficult to help people that don't want your help.
spanish: Es difícil ayudar a la gente que no quiere ayuda.

english: She is always trying to find happiness.
spanish: Ella siempre está intentando encontrar la felicidad.

english: He drinks a lot of milk every day.
spanish: Él toma mucha leche todos los días.

english: Teach me how to do that.
spanish: Enséñame como hacer eso.

english: Would you come here a moment?
spanish: ¿Puedes venir un momento?

english: He is not likely to succeed.
spanish: Probablemente él no tenga éxito.

english: Ask Tom to call me.
spanish: Pídele a Tom que me llame.

english: Mary was wearing a black sweater when I met her.
spanish: Mary vestía un suéter negro cuando la conocí.

english: I'm just trying to survive.
spanish: Solo estoy intentando sobrevivir.

english: He objected to our plan.
spanish: Él se opuso a nuestro plan.

english: I'll give a copy to anyone who asks for it.
spanish: Le daré una copia a cualquiera que la pida.

english: They defended their country against the invaders.
spanish: Ellos defendieron a su país de los invasores.

english: I saw a stranger enter that house.
spanish: Vi entrar a un desconocido en esa casa.

english: He secretly showed me her photograph.
spanish: Él me mostró su foto a escondidas.

english: Were you at the theater last Saturday?
spanish: ¿Estuviste en el teatro el sábado pasado?

english: My canary was killed by a cat.
spanish: A mi canario lo mató un gato.

english: A few people clapped after his lecture.
spanish: Unas pocas personas aplaudieron después de su clase.

english: He suddenly noticed his wallet was missing.
spanish: De repente se dio cuenta de que le faltaba la cartera.

english: I did not notice how she was dressed.
spanish: No me fijé en cómo ella iba vestida.

english: Do you know when Tom will be home?
spanish: ¿Sabes cuándo va a estar en casa Tom?

english: There were two glasses under the mirror.
spanish: Bajo el espejo había dos vasos.

english: You should assume that email messages aren't private.
spanish: Debes asumir que los e-mails no son privados.

english: You'll have a rough time.
spanish: Pasarás un mal rato.

english: Tom has begun to look for a job.
spanish: Tom ha empezado a buscar un trabajo.

english: Tom knocked on the door.
spanish: Tom golpeó la puerta.

english: It is no use your trying to deny it.
spanish: Es inútil que trates de negarlo.

english: How certain are you that he's a criminal?
spanish: ¿Qué tan seguro estás de que él es un criminal?

english: Your office isn't as large as mine.
spanish: Tu despacho no es tan grande como el mío.

english: He died without having made a will.
spanish: Él murió sin haber hecho un testamento.

english: I want a book in Swedish.
spanish: Quiero un libro en sueco.

english: I couldn't eat another bite.
spanish: No podría comer otro bocado.

english: He is just the man for the job.
spanish: Él es justo el hombre para el trabajo.

english: Would you like some more tea?
spanish: ¿Le gustaría un poco más de té?

english: Tom is old enough to vote.
spanish: Tom tiene edad suficiente para votar.

english: Tom wanted to see Mary happy.
spanish: Tom quería ver a Mary feliz.

english: The committee consists of fifteen people.
spanish: El comité consiste de quince personas.

english: That is the picture that he painted.
spanish: Aquél es el cuadro que él pintó.

english: The work is now in progress.
spanish: El trabajo ahora está en progreso.

english: He doesn't read many books.
spanish: No lee muchos libros.

english: You can't enter that bookstore with your shirt off.
spanish: No puedes entrar en la librería sin camiseta.

english: This tank has a capacity of thirty liters.
spanish: Este tanque tiene una capacidad de treinta litros.

english: He's the man of the house.
spanish: Él es el hombre de la casa.

english: How many siblings do you have?
spanish: ¿Cuántos hermanos tenés?

english: I have a dictionary in my hand.
spanish: Tengo un diccionario en la mano.

english: The police broke up the fight.
spanish: La policía puso fin a la pelea.

english: Tom was a good boy.
spanish: Tom era un buen chico.

english: Tom lent Mary his camera.
spanish: Tom le prestó su cámara a Mary.

english: I want to stay with you.
spanish: Quiero quedarme contigo.

english: What time did you go to bed last night?
spanish: ¿A qué hora te fuiste a dormir ayer por la noche?

english: I like dark red better.
spanish: Prefiero el rojo oscuro.

english: That was a close call.
spanish: Qué poco ha faltado.

english: Why are you always so cynical?
spanish: ¿Por qué siempre eres tan cínico?

english: I have trouble with physics.
spanish: Tengo problemas con física.

english: He set out for Tokyo.
spanish: Él partió hacia Tokio.

english: Call me if you find it.
spanish: Llámame si lo encuentras.

english: The two countries will negotiate a settlement to the crisis.
spanish: Los dos países negociarán una solución a la crisis.

english: They went on a trip a few days ago.
spanish: Vinieron de un viaje hace unos días.

english: Tom realized something wasn't right.
spanish: Tom se dio cuenta de que algo no iba bien.

english: Is it safe to skate on this lake?
spanish: ¿Es seguro patinar sobre este lago?

english: On the fifteenth of August, thousands of people fly kites.
spanish: El quince de agosto, miles de personas elevan volantines.

english: All our teachers were young and loved teaching.
spanish: Todos nuestros profesores eran jóvenes y amaban enseñar.

english: Tom put his pistol under his pillow.
spanish: Tom puso su pistola abajo de la almohada.

english: The doctor told me that I should eat less.
spanish: El médico me dijo que debería comer menos.

english: What happened in the park?
spanish: ¿Qué pasó en el parque?

english: I like the way you smile.
spanish: Me gusta cómo sonríes.

english: Can I watch your next game?
spanish: ¿Puedo ver tu próximo juego?

english: Indigenous Australians have eaten kangaroos for millenia.
spanish: Los indígenas australianos han comido canguros durante milenios.

english: Are you thinking of going to university?
spanish: ¿Piensas ir a la universidad?

english: The story ends with his death.
spanish: La historia termina con su muerte.

english: Just at that time, the bus stopped.
spanish: Justo en ese momento, el bus se detuvo.

english: Her stern look got him to quit talking.
spanish: La mirada severa de ella lo hizo callarse.

english: Everyone wanted to see what Tom was doing.
spanish: Todo el mundo quería ver lo que Tom estaba haciendo.

english: I don't want to end up in prison.
spanish: No quiero terminar en la cárcel.

english: When was the last time you sang?
spanish: ¿Cuándo fue la última vez que cantaste?

english: Are you sure I'm the only Canadian here?
spanish: ¿Estás seguro de que soy el único canadiense aquí?

english: What does Tom want to say to Mary?
spanish: ¿Qué quiere decirle Tom a Mary?

english: I play a little guitar.
spanish: Yo toco un poco de guitarra.

english: Do you go there often?
spanish: ¿Vas seguido allí?

english: I know you don't remember me.
spanish: Sé que no me recuerdas.

english: Spanish is her native language.
spanish: El español es su lengua materna.

english: I can't go back with them.
spanish: No puedo volver con ellos.

english: What time do you go to bed?
spanish: ¿A qué hora te vas a dormir?

english: There is a small pond here.
spanish: Aquí hay una pequeña laguna.

english: His novel has been translated into Japanese.
spanish: Su novela ha sido traducida al japonés.

english: The Golden Gate Bridge is made of iron.
spanish: El puente Golden Gate está hecho de hierro.

english: Why don't you consult a lawyer?
spanish: ¿Por qué no consultás con un abogado?

english: Are you a member of the baseball team?
spanish: ¿Eres miembro del equipo de béisbol?

english: I will explain the situation to you later on.
spanish: Te explicaré la situación después.

english: Many teachers have a problem with Tom.
spanish: Muchos profesores tienen problemas con Tom.

english: Are you ready to start your journey?
spanish: ¿Estás listo para comenzar tu jornada?

english: He is very zealous in his study of English.
spanish: Él es muy entusiasta en su estudio del inglés.

english: The TV was turned on.
spanish: La televisión estaba encendida.

english: Even if I wanted to, I couldn't do that.
spanish: Aún si quisiera, no podría hacer eso.

english: The Titanic sunk on its maiden voyage.
spanish: El Titanic se hundió en su primer viaje.

english: Do you want the job or not?
spanish: ¿Querés el trabajo o no?

english: She said something to him.
spanish: Ella le dijo algo.

english: That's why he got up early.
spanish: Fue por eso que él se levantó temprano.

english: Does everyone think it was me who stole the money?
spanish: ¿Todos piensan que fui yo quien robó el dinero?

english: Will you wake me at seven?
spanish: ¿Me despertarás a las siete?

english: There is a little boy walking with his dog.
spanish: Hay un niño pequeño caminando con su perro.

english: What do you like to eat?
spanish: ¿Qué te gusta comer?

english: Why is Tom so interested in that?
spanish: ¿Por qué Tom está tan interesado en eso?

english: The scandal ruined his career.
spanish: El escándalo arruinó su carrera.

english: I was on time for dinner.
spanish: Llegué a tiempo para la cena.

english: Were they in the library yesterday?
spanish: ¿Ayer estaban en la biblioteca?

english: My godfather gave me that red shirt.
spanish: Mi padrino me dio esa camisa roja.

english: I am an eighteen-year-old student of mathematics.
spanish: Soy un estudiante de matemáticas de dieciocho años.

english: They approached the tourists and asked them for money.
spanish: Ellos se aproximaron a los turistas y les pidieron dinero.

english: That was cooked in oil.
spanish: Eso fue cocinado en aceite.

english: The weather is terrible today.
spanish: Hoy hace un clima pésimo.

english: He visited China in 1998.
spanish: Él visitó China en 1998.

english: She lives next door to us.
spanish: Ella vive en la casa contigua.

english: She decided to get married to Tom.
spanish: Ella decidió casarse con Tom.

english: May I talk to Tom?
spanish: ¿Puedo hablar con Tom?

english: I'll be in my office.
spanish: Estaré en mi oficina.

english: Can I have one of these?
spanish: ¿Puede darme uno de éstos?

english: Get out of my house.
spanish: Vete de mi casa.

english: Don't tell Tom I'm here.
spanish: No le digas a Tom que estoy aquí.

english: Tom brought a gift for Mary.
spanish: Tom trajo un regalo para Mary.

english: She is really into knitting.
spanish: Ella está entusiasmada tejiendo.

english: Tom is a skillful carpenter.
spanish: Tom es un carpintero dotado.

english: Will you light the fire?
spanish: ¿Quiere encender el fuego?

english: You didn't eat much lunch.
spanish: No almorzaste mucho.

english: Better the devil you know than the devil you don't.
spanish: Más vale malo conocido que bueno por conocer.

english: Do you really want to talk to me?
spanish: ¿De verdad quieres conversar conmigo?

english: My grandmother's death was a big shock.
spanish: La muerte de mi abuela fue un gran shock.

english: I don't want you to treat me any differently.
spanish: No quiero que me trates de manera diferente.

english: He may have taken the wrong train.
spanish: Él debió tomar el tren equivocado.

english: I asked her out on a date.
spanish: La invité a una cita.

english: I'm going to Paris next month.
spanish: Yo voy a París el próximo mes.

english: I played with the baby on my knee.
spanish: Jugué con la bebé sobre mi rodilla.

english: I happen to agree with Tom.
spanish: Por cierto, estoy de acuerdo con Tom.

english: Everybody in the village looks up to him.
spanish: Todos en el pueblo lo admiran.

english: I put my suitcase in the trunk.
spanish: Puse mi maleta en el maletero.

english: Tom told me to slow down.
spanish: Tom me ha dicho que vaya más despacio.

english: Spring will be here before long.
spanish: La primavera estará aquí no dentro de mucho.

english: Could you hand me the newspaper on the table?
spanish: ¿Puedes pasarme el periódico de encima de la mesa?

english: Spanish is her mother tongue.
spanish: El español es su lengua materna.

english: I'm not quite sure yet.
spanish: Aún no estoy tan seguro.

english: Take the money with you.
spanish: Lleve usted el dinero consigo.

english: I want to stay here longer.
spanish: Quiero quedarme aquí más tiempo.

english: Do you want me to put Tom to bed?
spanish: ¿Quieres que lleve a Tom a la cama?

english: I admit that I was wrong.
spanish: Admito que me equivoqué.

english: Is it OK to feed my dog lettuce?
spanish: ¿Puedo darle lechuga a mi perro?

english: We have enough food now.
spanish: Tenemos comida suficiente ahora.

english: Tom doesn't like the way Mary talks.
spanish: A Tom no le gusta la forma de hablar de Mary.

english: Is Tom a good kisser?
spanish: ¿Es Tom bueno besando?

english: Take your father a cup of coffee.
spanish: Llévale una taza de café a tu padre.

english: I believe that the story is true.
spanish: Creo que la historia es cierta.

english: It's dangerous to jump off a moving train.
spanish: Es peligroso saltar de un tren en marcha.

english: The time has passed very quickly.
spanish: El tiempo ha pasado rapidísimo.

english: None of us speaks French.
spanish: Ninguno de nosotros habla en francés.

english: Is this the dictionary you're looking for?
spanish: ¿Es este el diccionario que estás buscando?

english: He's old enough to drive a car.
spanish: Tiene la edad suficiente como para conducir un auto.

english: I need somebody to talk to.
spanish: Necesita a alguien con quien hablar.

english: She despises people who lie.
spanish: Ella desprecia a la gente que miente.

english: He got good marks in math.
spanish: Él sacó buenas notas en matemáticas.

english: They began to look into the problem.
spanish: Empezaron a investigar sobre ese problema.

english: The city was bombed by enemy planes.
spanish: Aviones enemigos bombardearon la ciudad.

english: They say they cannot compete with low-priced foreign products.
spanish: Dicen que no pueden competir con los bajos precios de los productos extranjeros.

english: Do you know how to drive?
spanish: ¿Sabéis conducir?

english: When did you visit New York?
spanish: ¿Cuándo visitaste Nueva York?

english: You will have studied English for four years next March.
spanish: Habrás estudiado inglés por cuatro años el próximo marzo.

english: I thought Tom had gone to Boston.
spanish: Pensé que Tom había ido a Boston.

english: The frame itself is worth more than the picture.
spanish: El marco en si mismo es más valioso que el lienzo.

english: Why didn't Tom call for help?
spanish: ¿Por qué Tom no pidió ayuda?

english: It was a welcome surprise.
spanish: Fue una sorpresa de bienvenida.

english: Can it really be this bad?
spanish: ¿Realmente puede ser así de malo?

english: This boy is my son.
spanish: Este niño es mi hijo.

english: Neither side is without blame.
spanish: Ningún lado está libre de culpa.

english: We couldn't do anything for them.
spanish: No pudimos hacer nada por ellas.

english: Where is the registrar's office?
spanish: ¿Dónde está la oficina de registro?

english: You should make sure that you don't make Tom angry.
spanish: Deberías asegurarte de no hacer enfadar a Tom.

english: The prisoners tried to escape.
spanish: Los prisioneros intentaron escaparse.

english: Go say goodbye to them before they leave.
spanish: Ve a decirles adiós antes de que se vayan.

english: It was colder yesterday than today.
spanish: Ayer hacía más frío que hoy.

english: Tom seemed to have something on his mind.
spanish: Tom parecía tener algo en su mente.

english: You remind me of someone I used to know.
spanish: Me recuerdas a alguien que yo conocía.

english: I'm angry about what happened, too.
spanish: Yo también estoy enfadado con lo que pasó.

english: Tom arrived early this morning.
spanish: Tom llegó temprano esta mañana.

english: Could you drive more slowly?
spanish: ¿Podrías conducir más despacio?

english: Do you believe in love at the first sight?
spanish: ¿Crees en el amor a primera vista?

english: What he is saying doesn't make sense.
spanish: Lo que está diciendo no tiene sentido.

english: The collection is open to the public.
spanish: Esta colección está abierta al público.

english: It's not up to me.
spanish: No me corresponde.

english: Tom is good to me.
spanish: Tom es bueno conmigo.

english: The river flows between the two countries.
spanish: El río transcurre en medio de los dos países.

english: I couldn't get Tom to wake up.
spanish: No logré despertar a Tom.

english: We'll talk about it tomorrow.
spanish: Hablaremos de eso mañana.

english: Would you like to eat lunch together?
spanish: ¿Quieren almorzar con nosotros?

english: Tom didn't mean to hurt Mary.
spanish: Tom no quiso herir a Mary.

english: I'll get the fire started.
spanish: Yo prenderé el fuego.

english: She had a good time talking with him.
spanish: Ella se lo pasó bien hablando con él.

english: I don't see what's wrong with that.
spanish: No veo qué está mal con eso.

english: I heard a door slam.
spanish: Escuché un portazo.

english: My daughter is going to buy new furniture.
spanish: Mi hija va a comprar muebles nuevos.

english: That's one reason why I'll never do it again.
spanish: Esa es una de las razones por las que no lo volveré a hacer.

english: You can do whatever you like.
spanish: Puedes hacer lo que gustes.

english: We forgot to lock the door.
spanish: Se nos olvidó cerrar con llave la puerta.

english: He was drunk and forgot to shut the back door.
spanish: Él estaba ebrio y olvidó cerrar la puerta trasera.

english: I want to protect Tom.
spanish: Quiero proteger a Tom.

english: Can you come on Sunday evening?
spanish: ¿Puedes venir el domingo por la noche?

english: She's young enough to be your daughter.
spanish: Ella es lo suficientemente joven para ser tu hija.

english: Everyone thinks the same thing.
spanish: Todos piensan lo mismo.

english: I dedicate this song to you.
spanish: Te dedico esta canción.

english: How much money do you have?
spanish: ¿Cuánto dinero tienes?

english: Tom tripled his investment in six months.
spanish: Tom triplicó su inversión en seis meses.

english: Tom made a sandwich for lunch.
spanish: Tom preparó un sándwich para el almuerzo.

english: What will become of the child?
spanish: ¿Qué será del niño?

english: We don't like this house.
spanish: No nos gusta esta casa.

english: Tom told Mary what John wanted.
spanish: Tom dijo a Mary lo que John quería.

english: She's forgotten how to do it.
spanish: Ha olvidado el modo de hacerlo.

english: Tom listened to Mary singing.
spanish: Tom escuchó cantar a Mary.

english: I'll do everything you tell me to do.
spanish: Haré todo lo que me digas.

english: Tom didn't do the dishes.
spanish: Tom no lavó los platos.

english: He lives in a big house.
spanish: Él vive en una casa grande.

english: If anything happens to him, let me know.
spanish: Si algo le pasa, avísame.

english: He works on the farm from sunrise to sunset.
spanish: Él trabaja en la granja desde la mañana a la noche.

english: What time do you get up on Sundays?
spanish: ¿A qué hora te levantas los domingos?

english: We all laughed at his joke.
spanish: Todos nos reímos con su chiste.

english: I usually toss my loose change into my desk drawer.
spanish: Suelo echar el dinero suelto en el cajón del escritorio.

english: "Where have you been?" "I've been to the dentist."
spanish: "¿Dónde estuviste?" "En el dentista."

english: I knew it wasn't you.
spanish: Sabía que no era usted.

english: If it is fine tomorrow, we'll go on a picnic.
spanish: Si mañana hace buen tiempo, haremos un picnic.

english: Drink a lot of water.
spanish: Bebe un montón de agua.

english: I can't eat raw eggs. They have to be cooked.
spanish: No puedo comer huevos crudos, tienen que estar cocinados.

english: I no longer need your help.
spanish: Ya no necesito tu ayuda.

english: I want to scratch my nose.
spanish: Quiero rascarme la nariz.

english: He likes jazz, and so do I.
spanish: Le gusta el jazz, y a mí también.

english: Tom hasn't said a word all morning.
spanish: Tom no ha dicho una sola palabra en toda la mañana.

english: I don't think your name's Tom.
spanish: No creo que tu nombre sea Tom.

english: Tom hasn't bought bread yet.
spanish: Tomás todavía no compró pan.

spanish: Le paso con el presidente.

english: All the stories are interesting.
spanish: Todas las historias son interesantes.

spanish: Tengo ganas de comer algo dulce.

spanish: Esas nubes oscuras probablemente traigan la lluvia.

english: He called a taxi for me.
spanish: Llamó a un taxi para mi.

english: Would you like to be considered for the job?
spanish: ¿Te gustaría ser considerado para el trabajo?

spanish: Ellos son considerados la mejor banda de rock de la historia.

english: Tom would like some coffee.
spanish: Tom quisiera un poco de café.

spanish: Echaron a correr al ver al policía.

english: What do you do for a living?
spanish: ¿A qué se dedica?

spanish: Pensé que habías terminado.

spanish: Jamás lo he visto usar jeans.

english: I was the happiest man on earth.
spanish: Yo era el hombre más feliz de la Tierra.

spanish: Se me ordenó matarte.

spanish: Tom casi nunca se queja con el jefe.

spanish: Hablamos de nuestros planes para las vacaciones de verano.

english: I probably won't ever see Tom again.
spanish: Probablemente no volveré a ver a Tom jamás de nuevo.

english: But do you like it?
spanish: Pero, ¿te gusta?

spanish: ¿Quién va a pagar la comida?

english: I spent the weekend with my grandma.
spanish: Pasé el fin de semana con mi abuela.

english: As for me, I like chicken better than pork.
spanish: En mi caso, prefiero el pollo al cerdo.

english: Today is not your lucky day.
spanish: Hoy no es vuestro día de suerte.

english: Would you like to hear the story about Paul Bunyan?
spanish: ¿Te gustaría oír la historia de Paul Bunyan?

english: It was a strange night.
spanish: Fue una noche extraña.

english: I saw Tom in my dreams.
spanish: Vi a Tom en mis sueños.

english: I don't know if I can trust Tom.
spanish: No sé si puedo confiar en Tom.

english: I won't be able to visit you anymore.
spanish: No podré visitarte más.

spanish: ¿Para qué has comprado este diccionario tan caro?

spanish: Tu padre va a estar muy orgulloso de vos.

english: I'll put the suitcases in Tom's room.
spanish: Dejaré los maletines en la habitación de Tom.

english: Have you told anyone about the surprise party?
spanish: ¿Le has mencionado a alguien acerca de la fiesta sorpresa?

english: We must strive to do better.
spanish: Debemos esforzarnos por hacerlo mejor.

spanish: No perdamos esta oportunidad.

english: Tom is more interesting than Mary.
spanish: Tomás es más interesante que María.

english: Who's the girl I saw you talking to?
spanish: ¿Quién es la chica a la que te vi hablando?

english: I met him on the street by chance.
spanish: Me lo encontré de casualidad por la calle.

english: My father is very good at fishing.
spanish: Mi padre es muy bueno pescando.

english: Why are you so angry?
spanish: ¿Por qué estás enojado?

english: The teacher stressed the importance of taking notes.
spanish: El profesor remarcó la importancia de tomar apuntes.

english: Nations are fighting for freedom.
spanish: Los pueblos luchan por su libertad.

english: Now we can all relax.
spanish: Ahora podemos relajarnos todos.

english: I don't want to think about what could have happened.
spanish: No quiero pensar en lo que podría haber pasado.

english: The world is changing more and more quickly.
spanish: El mundo está cambiando cada vez más rápido.

english: I am getting off at the next station.
spanish: Me bajo en la siguiente estación.

english: I've waited for this too long.
spanish: He esperado demasiado tiempo por esto.

english: That company has been very successful up to now.
spanish: La compañía ha sido muy exitosa hasta ahora.

english: She greeted me with a big smile.
spanish: Ella me recibió con una gran sonrisa.

spanish: No dejes que esta oportunidad se te vaya.

english: I know I'm not supposed to be here.

english: I study English on Monday and Friday.
spanish: Estudio inglés los lunes y los viernes.

english: Don't cut in while others are talking.
spanish: No interrumpas cuando los demás están hablando.

english: She works in a bank.
spanish: Trabaja en un banco.

english: Tokyo is a huge city.
spanish: Tokio es una ciudad gigante.

english: I just wanted to help the team.
spanish: Sólo busqué ayudar el equipo.

english: Tom won't be able to understand any of this.
spanish: Tom no va a poder entender nada de esto.

english: Tom doesn't trust any of us.
spanish: Tom no confía en ninguno de nosotros.

english: Eat your dinner before it gets cold.
spanish: Cómete la cena antes de que se te enfríe.

english: Were there any stars in the sky?
spanish: ¿Había estrellas en el cielo?

english: Tom seems to lack energy.
spanish: A Tom parece faltarle energía.

english: He took over the business after his father died.
spanish: Él tomó el control del negocio después de que su padre muriera.

english: She'll love her husband forever.
spanish: Ella amará a su esposo para siempre.

english: Tokyo is the largest city in Japan.
spanish: Tokio es la ciudad más grande de Japón.

english: Do you know where she lives?
spanish: ¿Sabes dónde vive?

english: We have to be very careful.
spanish: Tenemos que ser muy cuidadosos.

english: I want an answer to that question.
spanish: Quiero una respuesta a esa pregunta.

english: You are no better at remembering things than I am.
spanish: No eres mejor recordando cosas de lo que soy yo.

english: You'll never guess what I saw this morning.
spanish: Nunca adivinarás qué vi esta mañana.

english: What's your favorite action movie?
spanish: ¿Cuál es tu película de acción preferida?

english: He washes his car at least once a week.
spanish: Él lava su coche al menos una vez a la semana.

english: Some people claim to know everything.
spanish: Algunos se atribuyen saberlo todo.

english: You should not waste your time.
spanish: No deberías desperdiciar tu tiempo.

english: What was he doing here?
spanish: ¿Qué estaba haciendo él aquí?

english: I have to find another one.
spanish: Tengo que encontrar otro.

english: I can't believe that you actually got into Harvard.
spanish: No me puedo creer que hayas logrado entrar en Harvard.

english: We sat down on a bench to talk.
spanish: Nosotros nos sentamos sobre un banco a conversar.

english: Is there a flight in the evening?
spanish: ¿Hay vuelos por la noche?

english: Do you have a moment?
spanish: ¿Tenéis un minuto?

english: This mission is highly secret and extremely dangerous.
spanish: Esta misión es ultra secreta y sumamente peligrosa.

english: I shouldn't have drunk that last bottle of beer.
spanish: No debería haberme bebido la última botella de cerveza.

english: Tom doesn't want the same thing to happen here.
spanish: Tom no quiere que ocurra lo mismo aquí.

english: I didn't get the joke.
spanish: No entendí la broma.

english: When was the last time you voted?
spanish: ¿Cuándo fue la última vez que votaste?

english: I take for granted that my answer is correct.
spanish: Doy por sentado que mi respuesta es correcta.

english: Guess what I want to do.
spanish: Adivina lo que quiero hacer.

english: There was a bridge across each river.
spanish: Había un puente entre cada río.

english: Excuse me, where are the eggs?
spanish: Disculpe, ¿dónde están los huevos?

spanish: ¿No hay algo que le quieras decir a Tom?

english: I can't tell you what happened.
spanish: No te puedo decir lo que pasó.

english: They called the dog Rocky.
spanish: Ellos llamaron al perro Rocky.

english: I have just been to the post office.
spanish: Acabo de estar en la oficina de correos.

english: May I borrow this book?
spanish: ¿Puedo tomar prestado este libro?

english: Tom will soon be back.
spanish: Tomás volverá pronto.

english: Tom doesn't have a car.
spanish: Tom no tiene un auto.

english: This is the real world.
spanish: Este es el mundo real.

english: I'm tired because I worked too much.
spanish: Estoy cansado porque trabajé demasiado.

english: I know you're worried about Tom.
spanish: Sé que está preocupada por Tom.

english: You needn't do it at once.
spanish: No necesitas hacerlo ya mismo.

english: Tom will paint the fence tomorrow.
spanish: Tom pintará la cerca mañana.

english: Tom thinks he's being shadowed by a private detective.
spanish: Tom piensa que está siendo seguido por un detective privado.

english: I have something to give you.
spanish: Yo tengo algo que darte.

english: Five miles is a long distance to walk.
spanish: 8 kilómetros es mucho para caminarlo.

english: You're not the only one who uses this computer.
spanish: No sos el único que usa esta computadora.

english: Do you shower every day?
spanish: ¿Usted se baña todos los días?

english: How long ago did you start learning Esperanto?
spanish: ¿Cuánto hace que empezaste a estudiar esperanto?

english: Poetry has no other goal than itself.
spanish: La poesía no tiene ningún objetivo aparte de ser ella misma.

english: She made a bet with him.
spanish: Ella hizo una apuesta con él.

english: Tom doesn't like my dog.
spanish: A Tom no le gusta mi perro.

english: It is finally all over.
spanish: Finalmente ha terminado.

english: Tom and Mary are both colleagues of mine.
spanish: Tom y Mary son los dos colegas míos.

english: I was pretty sick on Monday.
spanish: Estuve muy enfermo el lunes.

english: Mary became a nun and opened an orphanage.
spanish: Mary se hizo monja y abrió un orfanato.

english: Don't blame me for this.
spanish: No me culpes por eso.

english: The art gallery was very crowded.
spanish: La galería de pintura estaba muy concurrida.

english: Everybody makes mistakes once in a while.
spanish: Todo el mundo comete errores de vez en cuando.

english: Tom doesn't seem to understand.
spanish: Tom parece no entender.

english: Why haven't you told Tom?
spanish: ¿Por qué no le has dicho a Tom?

english: Tom spilled the beans to Mary.
spanish: Tom le contó el secreto a Mary.

english: Did you know that men can get breast cancer?
spanish: ¿Sabías que los hombres pueden tener cáncer de mama?

english: This service is temporarily out of order.
spanish: Este servicio está temporalmente no disponible.

english: Can you tell me the time?
spanish: ¿Me podría decir la hora?

spanish: Nos levantamos con el pie incorrecto.

english: This country is safe from attack.
spanish: Este país está a salvo de un ataque.

spanish: Hay muchas buenas razones para no hacerlo.

english: I'm looking forward to it.
spanish: Estoy deseando que llegue.

english: My wife made me a delicious apple cake.
spanish: Mi esposa me hizo una deliciosa torta de manzana.

english: That is all I know about him.
spanish: Eso es todo lo que sé sobre él.

english: He took off his glasses after that.
spanish: Después de eso, se quitó las gafas.

english: Who died and made you king?

spanish: Está poniendo la mesa para el desayuno.

english: What was his reaction to this news?
spanish: ¿Cuál fue su reacción a esta noticia?

english: Let me know what you find out.
spanish: Comunícame lo que averigües.

english: Parallel lines do not intersect each other.
spanish: La líneas paralelas no se cruzan entre ellas.

english: I don't want to die now.
spanish: No quiero morir ahora.

english: This isn't my first time to be here.
spanish: Esta no es la primera vez que estoy acá.

english: Had I realized what you intended, I wouldn't have agreed.
spanish: Si me hubiera dado cuenta de lo que tramabas, no lo habría concedido.

english: It's you that she loves, not me.
spanish: Es a ti a quien ella ama, no a mí.

english: It will be rather difficult for him.

english: Tom was out of control.

spanish: Está un poco frío.

english: The monkeys are grooming each other.
spanish: Los monos se espulgan unos a otros.

english: He has a small advantage.
spanish: Tiene una pequeña ventaja.

english: I had a light lunch.
spanish: Comí un almuerzo liviano.

spanish: La enfermedad de Mary no le impide disfrutar la vida.

spanish: Tienes que venir conmigo.

english: The law says that all men are equal.
spanish: La ley dice que todos los hombres son iguales.

english: I heard you were back in town.
spanish: Oí que estabas de regreso en el pueblo.

english: Tom likes his beer really cold.
spanish: A Tomás le gusta la cerveza muy fría.

english: I know I can do it.

english: I hope that she will help me.
spanish: Espero que ella me ayude.

english: Could I ask a favor of you?
spanish: ¿Puedo pedirte un favor?

english: I'm staying at a hotel for the time being.
spanish: Vivo en un hotel por ahora.

english: He can't be older than me.
spanish: No puede ser mayor que yo.

english: Tom sure can play tennis.
spanish: Claro que Tom sabe jugar al tenis.

english: When I heard that, I put two and two together.
spanish: Al oírlo, até cabos.

english: Jackson could not trust them.
spanish: Jackson no podía confiar en ellas.

english: Take your time. There's no rush.
spanish: Tomate tu tiempo, no hay apuro.

spanish: Por favor, dame otra oportunidad.

english: Tom gave me some advice.
spanish: Tom me dio algunos consejos.

english: If you were in my place, what would you do?

english: A square has four angles.
spanish: Un cuadrado tiene cuatro ángulos.

english: I'll meet them at six.

english: It took three days to paint the whole house.
spanish: Tomó tres días pintar la casa entera.

english: If you want to see Tom, you have to hurry.
spanish: Si querés ver a Tom, tenés que apurarte.

english: None of them could understand what she was implying.
spanish: Ninguno de ellos fue capaz de entender lo que ella estaba insinuando.

english: There's something I'd like to show you.
spanish: Hay algo que me gustaría enseñarte.

english: I like this. I will take it.
spanish: Me gusta este, me lo llevo.

english: Why do you want to work here?
spanish: ¿Por qué querés trabajar acá?

english: The plane takes off at 8:00 a.m.
spanish: El avión despega a las 8:00 a.m.

english: Tom doesn't want to do that.
spanish: Tom no quiere hacer eso.

english: I can't believe you're talking to me like this.
spanish: No me puedo creer que me estés hablando así.

english: Would you like white wine or red?
spanish: ¿Quieres vino blanco o vino tinto?

english: Tom hardly ever goes to bed before midnight.
spanish: Tom rara vez va a la cama antes de medianoche.

english: Am I going to die?
spanish: ¿Voy a morir?

english: Tom has a list of things to do.
spanish: Tom tiene una lista de cosas que hacer.

english: Tom doesn't need to hurry.
spanish: Tom no necesita apresurarse.

english: My husband and I used to go mountain climbing together.
spanish: Mi esposo y yo solíamos escalar montañas juntos.

english: I couldn't go to your birthday party.
spanish: No pude ir a su fiesta de cumpleaños.

english: As was expected, he won the prize.
spanish: Tal como se esperaba, él ganó el premio.

english: I want to know the truth.
spanish: Quiero saber la verdad.

english: You must be the new teacher.
spanish: Usted debe ser la nueva profesora.

english: Is your coworker an American?
spanish: ¿Es tu socio un americano?

english: He was tired, but he kept working.
spanish: Estaba cansado, pero siguió trabajando.

english: Tom is a ballet dancer.
spanish: Tomás es bailarín de ballet.

english: Aim at the target with this gun.
spanish: Apunta el objetivo con esta pistola.

spanish: Su único deseo era volver a ver a su hijo una vez más.

english: It must have been terrible.
spanish: Debe haber sido terrible.

english: She wanted to go out anyway.
spanish: De todas formas, ella quería salir.

english: We passed through the Panama Canal.
spanish: Pasamos por el canal de Panamá.

english: Why are you so worried?
spanish: ¿Por qué está tan preocupado?

english: An elderly person was resting under a tree.
spanish: Un anciano reposaba bajo un árbol.

english: The cost amounted to twelve pesos.
spanish: El gasto llegó a doce pesos.

english: I kind of liked them.
spanish: Creo que me gustaban.

english: Can you teach me English?
spanish: ¿Me puedes enseñar inglés?

english: Why don't we take a short break?
spanish: ¿Por qué no nos tomamos un breve recreo?

english: Tom has to look for a job.
spanish: Tom tiene que buscar un trabajo.

english: I think I have a fever.
spanish: Creo que tengo fiebre.

english: For more information, contact us.
spanish: Para más información, póngase en contacto con nosotros.

english: The escaped convict is armed and dangerous.
spanish: El convicto fugado está armado y es peligroso.

english: He works in a factory.
spanish: Trabaja en una fábrica.

english: Do you wish to make any other transaction?
spanish: ¿Deseas hacer cualquier otra transacción?

english: I have the feeling that I'll sleep well tonight.
spanish: Tengo la impresión de que hoy voy a dormir bien.

english: What kind of food do you want?
spanish: ¿Qué tipo de comida quieres?

english: You and I are going together.
spanish: Tú y yo vamos juntos.

english: If there are mistakes, correct them.
spanish: Si hay errores, corrígelos.

english: I'm thinking of going to Boston next month.
spanish: Estoy pensando en ir a Boston el mes que viene.

english: Tom comes and sees me once in a while.
spanish: Tom viene a verme de vez en cuando.

english: He rose from his seat.
spanish: Se levantó de su sitio.

english: I've only heard good things about him.
spanish: Sólo he oído buenas cosas de él.

english: She advised him to lose weight.
spanish: Ella le aconsejó que perdiera peso.

english: You should take off your coat.
spanish: Deberían quitarse su abrigo.

english: Tom moved through the dimly-lit alley.
spanish: Tom se movió a través de la callejuela poco iluminada.

english: Tom turned off the alarm.
spanish: Tom apagó la alarma.

english: She gave her oath that she would not drink.
spanish: Ella dió su palabra de que no bebería.

english: I got my hair cut.
spanish: Me he cortado el pelo.

english: You might be surprised at the outcome.
spanish: Tú quizás podrías estar sorprendido del resultado.

english: Do you have any idea who wrote this book?
spanish: ¿Tienes alguna idea de quién escribió este libro?

english: I think you ought to rest a while.
spanish: Creo que deberías descansar un poco.

english: She did not turn up.
spanish: Ella no apareció.

english: They were too tired to climb a mountain.
spanish: Estaban tan cansados que no subieron a la montaña.

english: Three pedestrians were victims of an accident.
spanish: Tres peatones fueron víctimas de un atropello.

english: I can't work any more.
spanish: No puedo trabajar más.

english: Every Sunday afternoon, I go to the bazaar.
spanish: Voy al bazar todos los domingos por la tarde.

english: You know something about this, don't you?
spanish: Sabes algo acerca de esto, ¿verdad?

english: Tom died in my arms.
spanish: Tom murió en mis brazos.

english: Don't kill the goose that lays the golden eggs.
spanish: No mates a la gallina de los huevos de oro.

english: Did you collect the money they owed you?
spanish: ¿Cobró usted el dinero que le debían?

english: This coffee is so hot that I can't drink it.
spanish: Este café está tan caliente que no puedo bebérmelo.

english: Tom advised Mary not to go there by herself.
spanish: Tom le aconsejó a Mary que no fuera allá sola.

english: Tom and Mary are my best friends.
spanish: Tom y Mary son mis mejores amigos.

english: Tom is doing very well today.
spanish: Tom lo está haciendo muy bien hoy.

english: He is more lucky than clever.
spanish: Él es más suertudo que astuto.

english: He asked for my permission to use the phone.
spanish: Él me pidió permiso para utilizar el teléfono.

english: It was a great shock to me.
spanish: Para mí fue muy impactante.

english: Each time I see this picture, I remember my father.
spanish: Cada vez que veo esta fotografía recuerdo a mi padre.

english: I want to eat something that isn't sweet.
spanish: Quiero comer algo que no esté dulce.

english: I don't want this to happen again.
spanish: No quiero que esto suceda otra vez.

english: I didn't realize you were awake.
spanish: No me di cuenta de que estabas despierto.

english: She has a lot of money.
spanish: Tiene mucho dinero.

english: He reached for the pistol.
spanish: Él echó mano de la pistola.

english: Do you run every day?
spanish: ¿Corres todos los días?

english: I was unable to look her in the face.
spanish: Fui incapaz de mirarle a la cara.

english: Tom's in love with Mary's best friend.
spanish: Tom está enamorado de la mejor amiga de Mary.

english: Please call me up tonight at my office.
spanish: Hágame el favor de llamarme esta noche a mi oficina.

english: I will be free next Saturday.
spanish: Estaré libre el sábado que viene.

english: Don't you feel in some way responsible?
spanish: ¿No te sientes de alguna manera responsable?

english: Tom ate only three carrots for lunch.
spanish: Tom comió solo tres zanahorias de almuerzo.

english: Tom thinks about Mary all the time.
spanish: Tom piensa en Mary todo el tiempo.

english: The dog came running to me.
spanish: El perro vino corriendo hacia mí.

english: I would've done that if I'd known it was necessary.
spanish: Lo habría hecho si hubiese sabido que era necesario.

english: One stayed and the other went away.
spanish: Uno se quedó y el otro se fue.

english: All but one were present.
spanish: Todos estaban presentes excepto por una persona.

english: Did Tom tell Mary what John said?
spanish: ¿Le contó Tom a Mary lo que dijo John?

english: Do you drink coffee every day?
spanish: ¿Bebes café todos los días?

english: If we walk, we'll be very late.
spanish: Si vamos a pie tardaremos mucho.

english: He's a former student of mine.
spanish: Es un antiguo alumno mío.

english: He stuck the book in his bag.
spanish: Él metió el libro en su mochila.

english: There is nothing funny about him.
spanish: Esto no tiene nada de divertido.

english: Do you really think we don't have to do that?
spanish: ¿Crees realmente que no tenemos que hacerlo?

english: Somebody has to go first.
spanish: Alguien tiene que ir primero.

english: A bow is no use without arrows.
spanish: Un arco no sirve de nada sin flechas.

english: I thought you should read these documents.
spanish: Pensé que deberías leer estos documentos.

english: What did you say your name was?
spanish: ¿Cómo dices que te llamabas?

english: Can you pick it up?
spanish: ¿Lo puedes recoger?

english: How does he do it?
spanish: ¿Cómo lo hace?

english: If you can't read, it's not my fault.
spanish: No es culpa mía que ustedes no sepan leer.

english: It will probably snow tomorrow.
spanish: Probablemente mañana nevará.

english: Who will come with us?
spanish: ¿Quién vendrá con nosotros?

english: I don't feel like eating now.
spanish: Ahora no tengo ganas de comer.

english: I will lend you money just this once.
spanish: Te prestaré dinero solo por esta vez.

english: I live on the first floor.
spanish: Vivo en el primer piso.

english: Why are you so mad?
spanish: ¿Por qué estás tan enojado?

english: If that man makes one more mistake, I'll fire him.
spanish: Si ese hombre comete otro error, lo despediré.

english: Please do something about it.
spanish: Por favor, haz algo al respecto.

english: How was the French class?
spanish: ¿Cómo estuvo la clase de francés?

english: She is afraid of cats.
spanish: Ella teme a los gatos.

english: I gazed at the sea for hours.
spanish: Contemplé el mar durante horas.

english: He has been to Hokkaido.
spanish: Él ha estado en Hokkaido.

english: Yesterday Tom stayed home all day.
spanish: Ayer Tom se quedó todo el día en casa.

english: What I want now is ice cream.
spanish: Lo que quiero ahora es helado.

english: The patient is now out of danger.
spanish: El paciente está ahora fuera de peligro.

english: There were bits of broken glass on the floor.
spanish: Había trozos de vidrio roto en el piso.

english: No students went there yesterday.
spanish: Ningún estudiante fue ahí ayer.

english: Tom wants to buy an apartment in Boston.
spanish: Tom quiere comprar un apartamento en Boston.

english: Tom seems to believe everything Mary says.
spanish: Tom parece creerse todo lo que dice Mary.

english: This is where he used to work.
spanish: Este es el lugar donde él trabajaba.

english: I shouldn't have to do all this work myself.
spanish: No debería tener que hacer todo este trabajo yo solo.

english: You have to obey your parents.
spanish: Has de obedecer a tus padres.

english: Tom is a friend of Mary's.
spanish: Tom es un amigo de Mary.

english: I just wanted to say goodbye.
spanish: Solo quería decir adiós.

english: I can't put up with his violence any longer.
spanish: No puedo soportar más su violencia.

english: He asked about the others.
spanish: Él preguntó por los demás.

english: I want to know what happened to Tom.
spanish: Quiero saber qué le pasó a Tom.

english: Ice hockey is an exciting sport.
spanish: El hockey sobre hielo es un deporte emocionante.

english: The earth moves around the sun.
spanish: La Tierra orbita al Sol.

english: Frankly speaking, his speeches are always dull.
spanish: Sinceramente, sus discursos siempre son aburridos.

english: I said hello to her and she smiled.
spanish: Le dije hola y ella sonrió.

english: They want to kill me.
spanish: Me quieren matar.

english: I wonder if he'll come tonight.
spanish: Me pregunto si él vendrá esta noche.

english: A number of traffic accidents have happened recently.
spanish: Han habido un número de accidentes de tráfico recientemente.

english: She greeted me with a pleasant smile.
spanish: Ella me saludó con una agradable sonrisa.

english: I think you know what I think.
spanish: Creo que sabes lo que pienso.

english: The ground was covered with leaves.
spanish: El suelo estaba cubierto de hojas.

english: You should be proud of what you've accomplished.
spanish: Deberías estar orgulloso de lo que has conseguido.

english: His overcoat is worn out.
spanish: Su gabardina está desgastada.

english: The bus left five minutes ahead of time.
spanish: El bus salió cinco minutos antes de tiempo.

english: Poverty had taught him to stand on his own feet.
spanish: La pobreza le ha enseñado a vivir por su cuenta.

english: Do you have a calculator that I could borrow?
spanish: ¿Tienes una calculadora para dejarme?

english: I'd like to make a call.
spanish: Quisiera hacer una llamada.

english: Tom told Mary it wouldn't be easy.
spanish: Tom le dijo a Mary que no sería sencillo.

english: The car exploded a few moments after the collision.
spanish: El auto explotó pocos instantes después del impacto.

english: I saw him run away.
spanish: Lo vi huir.

english: She accused me of being a liar.
spanish: Ella me acusó de ser una mentirosa.

english: The days are longer in the summer.
spanish: Los días son más largos en verano.

english: I asked him if he was busy.
spanish: Le pregunté si estaba ocupado.

english: Mary is a very strong-willed woman.
spanish: Mary es una mujer muy obstinada.

english: Don't tell Tom. He'll tell everyone.
spanish: No se lo digas a Tom, se lo dirá a todo el mundo.

english: I have nothing in particular to do tomorrow.
spanish: Mañana no tengo nada que hacer en particular.

english: Italy is a very beautiful country.
spanish: Italia es un país muy bonito.

english: I only come once in a blue moon.
spanish: Sólo vengo de Pascuas a Ramos.

english: These books are worth reading at least once.
spanish: Vale la pena leer estos libros al menos una vez.

english: Once a month, she has lunch with her father.
spanish: Ella almuerza con su padre una vez al mes.

english: Tom couldn't remember where he'd parked his car.
spanish: Tom no lograba acordarse de dónde había aparcado.

english: Would you please write your name here?
spanish: ¿Podrías escribir tu nombre aquí, por favor?

english: She was too tired to go on working.
spanish: Ella estaba demasiado cansada para poder continuar trabajando.

english: Does Europe have a common language?
spanish: ¿Tiene Europa una lengua común?

english: She plays tennis every day.
spanish: Ella juega al tenis todos los días.

english: I don't want to get in trouble.
spanish: No quiero meterme en líos.

english: It won't be an easy thing to do.
spanish: No será algo fácil de hacer.

english: Why are you ruining my life?
spanish: ¿Por qué me arruinas la vida?

english: We're going to wait until Tom gets here.
spanish: Vamos a esperar hasta que Tomás llegue aquí.

english: We walked another hundred yards.
spanish: Caminamos otras cien yardas.

english: Wounded bears are usually very dangerous.
spanish: Los osos heridos normalmente son muy peligrosos.

english: He laughed at my joke.
spanish: Él se rió de mi broma.

english: Where do you want it?
spanish: ¿En dónde lo quieres?

english: I'll be out of town for a few days.
spanish: Estaré fuera de la ciudad un par de días.

english: Tom returned the keys to Mary.
spanish: Tom le devolvió las llaves a Mary

english: Tom took a sip of wine.
spanish: Tom bebió un sorbo de vino.

english: Stay here for a moment.
spanish: Quédate aquí por un momento.

english: I didn't know where to get the bus.
spanish: No sabía dónde tomar el micro.

english: Tango lived with a small boy in a small village.
spanish: Tango vivía con un niño pequeño en un pequeño pueblo.

english: I can't tell if Tom is joking or not.
spanish: No sé decir si Tom está bromeando o no.

english: You must do as I tell you.
spanish: Debes hacer lo que te digo.

english: You've bitten off more than you can chew.
spanish: Te has metido en camisa de once varas.

english: I am in touch with him.
spanish: Estoy en contacto con él.

english: Tom pushed Mary into the elevator.
spanish: Tom empujó a María al ascensor.

english: Did you return Tom's book?
spanish: ¿Devolviste el libro de Tom?

english: I've always wanted to visit another country.
spanish: Siempre quise visitar otro país.

english: Do you have an alarm clock in your room?
spanish: ¿Tienes despertador en tu habitación?

english: Open the window, will you?
spanish: ¿Puedes abrir la ventana?

english: I will give you a bicycle for your birthday.
spanish: Te voy a regalar una bicicleta para tu cumpleaños.

english: Do you have professional experience?
spanish: ¿Tenés experiencia profesional?

english: Did you get my letter?
spanish: ¿Recibiste mi carta?

english: She accused him of having lied to her.
spanish: Ella le acusó de haberle mentido.

english: Don't be late for school.
spanish: No lleguéis tarde a la escuela.

english: You feel lonesome, don't you?
spanish: Te sientes solo, ¿verdad?

english: It rained for a week.
spanish: Llovió durante una semana.

english: He got bored after fifteen minutes.
spanish: Él se aburrió a los quince minutos.

english: Small children often like books about dragons and other monsters.
spanish: Comúnmente a los niños pequeños le gustan los libros sobre dragones y otros monstruos.

english: I did it on my own.
spanish: Lo hice yo solo.

english: Everything's going to be OK.
spanish: Todo va a estar bien.

english: I hope that all your dreams come true.
spanish: Espero que todos tus sueños se cumplan.

english: The facts are not clear.
spanish: Los hechos no son claros.

english: Anybody can make a mistake.
spanish: El que tiene boca se equivoca.

english: You should spend more time outside and less time inside.
spanish: Deberías pasar más tiempo fuera y menos tiempo dentro.

english: Tom and Mary are vegetarians.
spanish: Tom y Mary son vegetarianos.
